‘⁸ Picture white, (white lead,) tzinkiari‚ (light green‚) lachouri, (purple,) lake, arsenio, cannot be employed in painting upon walls; all other colours can serve. Only you must observe that you cannot employ cinnabar upon any place outside the church and much exposed to the wind, because this colour would blacken. You must then mix it with much white. “ Take bran, wash it and rinse it. Then allow the water which has served sor this purpose to repose ; then boil it, and when it is cooked you can mix it with azure and paint the grounds.
